ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Prerequisites/Preconditions] This protocol operates against a site that is identified by a URL that protocol clients recognize.
[In Prerequisites/Preconditions] The protocol server endpoint is formed by appending "/_vti_bin/versions.asmx" to the URL of the site.
[In Prerequisites/Preconditions] Here is an example of a protocol server endpoint: http://www.contoso.com/Repository/_vti_bin/versions.asmx
[In Prerequisites/Preconditions] This protocol assumes that the underlying protocols have performed authentication.
[In Transport] Protocol servers MUST support SOAP over HTTP.
[In Transport] Protocol servers SHOULD additionally support SOAP over HTTPS for enhancing the security of communication with protocol clients.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-VERSS_R5

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Transport] Implementation does additionally support SOAP over HTTPS for enhancing the security of communication with protocol clients. (Windows SharePoint Services 3.0 and above follow this behavior.)
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: This requirement can be enabled/disabled in the deployment.ptfconfig file.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Transport] Protocol messages MUST be formatted as specified in either [SOAP1.1] section 4 or [SOAP1.2-1/2007] section 5.
[In Transport] Protocol messages can be formatted as specified in [SOAP1.1] section 4.
[In Transport] Protocol messages can be formatted as specified in [SOAP1.2-1/2007] section 5.

[In Transport] Protocol server faults MUST be returned via HTTP status codes, as specified in [RFC2616] section 10, or via SOAP faults, as specified in either [SOAP1.1] section 4.4 or [SOAP1.2-1/2007] section 5.4.
[In Transport] Protocol server faults can be returned via HTTP status codes, as specified in [RFC2616] section 10.
[In Transport] Protocol server faults can be returned via SOAP faults, as specified in [SOAP1.1] section 4.4.
[In Transport] Protocol server faults can be returned via SOAP faults, as specified in [SOAP1.2-1/2007] section 5.4.
[In Common Message Syntax] This section contains common definitions that this protocol uses.
[In Common Message Syntax] The syntax of the definitions uses XML schema as defined in [XMLSCHEMA1] and [XMLSCHEMA2], and WSDL as defined in [WSDL].
[In Namespaces] This specification defines and references XML namespaces by using the mechanisms specified in [XMLNS].

[In Namespaces] Although this specification associates a specific XML namespace prefix for each XML namespace that is used, the choice of any particular XML namespace prefix is implementation-specific and not significant for interoperability.
[In Namespaces] Prefix "Http" is used for namespace URI "http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/http/".
[In Namespaces] Prefix "Mime" is used for namespace URI "http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/mime/".
[In Namespaces] Prefix "S" is used for namespace URI "http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema", more information refers to "[XMLSCHEMA1]".
[In Namespaces] Prefix "Soap" is used for namespace URI "http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/soap/", more information refers to "[SOAP1.1]".
[In Namespaces] Prefix "Soapenc" is used for namespace URI "http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/encoding/".
[In Namespaces] Prefix "soap12" is used for namespace URl "http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/soap12/", more information refers to "[SOAP1.2-1/2007] [SOAP1.2-2/2007]".
[In Namespaces] Prefix "Tm" is used for namespace URI "http://microsoft.com/wsdl/mime/textMatching/".
[In Namespaces] Prefix "Tns" is used for namespace URI "http://schemas.microsoft.com/sharepoint/soap/".
[In Namespaces] Prefix "Wsdl" is used for namespace URI "http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/", more information refers to "[WSDL]".
[In Namespaces] No prefix is used for namespace URI "http://schemas.microsoft.com/sharepoint/soap/".
[In Messages] This specification does not define any common WSDL message definitions.
[In Elements] The following table summarizes the set of common XML schema element [fileName, fileVersion]definitions defined by this specification.
[In Elements] XML schema element [fileName, fileVersion] definitions that are specific to a particular operation are described with the operation.
[In Elements] Element "fileName" defines the location of a file on the protocol server.
[In Elements] Element "fileVersion" defines the version number of the file on the protocol server.
[In fileName] The fileName element defines the location of a file on the protocol server.
[In fileName] <s:element name="fileName" type="s:string" />
[In fileName] The fileName element MUST be specified in one of the following formats: The URL of the file; The location of the file relative to the site that contains it.
[In fileName] The fileName element MUST be specified in the form folder1/folder2/…/file-name.

[In fileName] The placeholders are defined as follows: The folder1 and folder2 placeholders represent the names of folders; folder1 represents the topmost folder on the site; The file-name placeholder represents the name of the file.
[In fileVersion] The fileVersion element defines the version number of a file on the protocol server.
[In fileVersion] The fileVersion element SHOULD contain the major version and minor version numbers connected by period, for example, "1.0".
[In fileVersion] <s:element name="fileVersion" type="s:string" />
[In Complex Types] The following table summarizes the set of common XML schema complex type [Results, SOAPFaultDetails, VersionData] definitions defined by this specification.
[In Complex Types] XML schema complex type [Results, SOAPFaultDetails, VersionData] definitions that are specific to a particular operation are described with the operation.
[In Complex Types] [The description of] Complex type "Results" is the details about all versions of a file on the protocol server.
[In Complex Types] [The description of] Complex type "SOAPFaultDetails" is the details about a SOAP fault.
[In Complex Types] [The description of] Complex type "VersionData" is the details about a version of a file on the protocol server.
[In Results] The Results complex type provides the details about all versions of a specified file that the user can access.

[In Results] The DeleteAllVersions, DeleteVersion, GetVersions, and RestoreVersion methods return the Results complex type. <s:complexType name="Results"> <s:sequence> <s:element name="list" maxOccurs="1" minOccurs="1"> <s:complexType> <s:attribute name="id" type="s:string" use="required" /> </s:complexType> </s:element> <s:element name="versioning" maxOccurs="1" minOccurs="1"> <s:complexType> <s:attribute name="enabled" type="s:unsignedByte" use="required" /> </s:complexType> </s:element> <s:element name="settings" maxOccurs="1" minOccurs="1"> <s:complexType> <s:attribute name="url" type="s:string" use="required" /> </s:complexType> </s:element> <s:element name="result" maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="1" type="tns:VersionData"/> </s:sequence> </s:complexType>
[In Results] list: Contains information about the document library that is represented by this list.
[In Results] list.id: Specifies the GUID of the document library in which the file resides.
[In Results] versioning: Contains version-related information about the file.
[In Results] versioning.enabled: Specifies whether versioning is enabled on the file.
[In Results] versioning.enabled: The value of this attribute [versioning.enabled] MUST be "0" or "1".
[In Results] versioning.enabled: A value of "0" indicates that versioning is disabled.
[In Results] versioning.enabled: a value of "1" indicates that versioning is enabled.
[In Results] settings: Contains information about how versioning operates for the file.
[In Results] settings.url: Specifies the URL to the webpage of versioning-related settings for the document library in which the file resides.
[In Results] result: Specifies details about a version of the file on the protocol server.
[In Results] result: A separate result element MUST exist for each version of the file that the user can access.
[In Results] result: For details about the type of this element, see section 2.2.4.3.

[In SOAPFaultDetails] The SOAPFaultDetails complex type specifies the details about a SOAP fault. <s:schema xmlns:s="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" targetNamespace=" http://schemas.microsoft.com/sharepoint/soap"> <s:complexType name="SOAPFaultDetails"> <s:sequence> <s:element name="errorstring" type="s:string"/> <s:element name="errorcode" type="s:string" minOccurs="0"/> </s:sequence> </s:complexType> </s:schema>
[In SOAPFaultDetails] errorstring: Human-readable text that explains the application-level fault.
[In SOAPFaultDetails] errorcode: The hexadecimal representation of a 4-byte result code.

[In VersionData] The VersionData complex type specifies the details about a single version of a file. <s:complexType name="VersionData"> <s:attribute name="version" type="s:string" use="required" /> <s:attribute name="url" type="s:string" use="required" /> <s:attribute name="created" type="s:string" use="required" /> <s:attribute name="createdRaw" type="s:string" use="required" /> <s:attribute name="createdBy" type="s:string" use="required" /> <s:attribute name="createdByName" type="s:string" use="optional" /> <s:attribute name="size" type="s:unsignedLong" use="required" /> <s:attribute name="comments" type="s:string" use="required" /> </s:complexType>
[In VersionData] version: The version of the file.
[In VersionData] version: The most recent version of the file MUST be preceded with an at sign (@).
[In VersionData] version: All the other versions MUST exist without any prefix.

[In VersionData] version: For example, if a file has two versions—1.0 and 2.0, with 2.0 being the most recent version of the file—the value of this attribute for the most recent file is "@2.0", and the value for the previous version is "1.0".
[In VersionData] version: The format SHOULD contain the version of the file, including the major version and minor version numbers connected by period, for example, "1.0".
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-VERSS_R60101

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In VersionData] url: The complete URL of the version of the file.
[In VersionData] created: The creation date and time for the version of the file that is displayed, using an implementation-specific format.
[In VersionData] createdRaw: The creation date and time for the version of the file in Datetime format, as specified in [ISO-8601].<1>
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirements: MS-VERSS_R16401, MS-VERSS_R16402

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In VersionData] createdBy: The creator of the version of the file.
[In VersionData] createdByName: The display name of the creator of the version of the file.
[In VersionData] size: The size, in bytes, of the version of the file.
[In VersionData] comments: The comment entered when the version of the file was replaced on the protocol server during check in.
[In Simple Types] This specification does not define any common XML schema simple type definitions.
[In Attributes] This specification does not define any common XML schema attribute definitions.
[In Groups] This specification does not define any common XML schema group definitions.
[In Attribute Groups] This specification does not define any common XML schema attribute group definitions.
[In Protocol Details] The client side of this protocol is simply a pass-through.
[In Protocol Details] That is, no additional timers or other state is required on the client side of this protocol.

[In Protocol Details] Calls made by the higher-layer protocol or application are passed directly to the transport, and the results returned by the transport are passed directly back to the higher-layer protocol or application.
[In Protocol Details] Except where specified, protocol clients SHOULD interpret HTTP status codes returned by the protocol server as specified in [RFC2616] section 10.

[In Protocol Details] This protocol allows protocol servers to provide additional details for SOAP faults by including either a detail element as specified in [SOAP1.1] section 4.4 or a Detail element as specified in [SOAP1.2-1/2007] section 5.4.5.
[In Protocol Details] These elements conform to the XSD of the SOAPFaultDetails complex type specified in section 2.2.4.2.
[In Protocol Details] Except where specified, these SOAP faults are not significant for interoperability, and protocol clients can interpret them in an implementation-specific manner.

[In Protocol Details] This protocol allows protocol servers to perform implementation-specific authorization checks and notify protocol clients of authorization faults either by using HTTP status codes or by using SOAP faults as specified previously in this section.
[In VersionsSoap Server Details] The server side of this protocol contains the following operations: DeleteAllVersions, DeleteVersion, GetVersions and RestoreVersion.
[In VersionsSoap Server Details] Information returned from the GetVersions operation is used to call the DeleteVersion and RestoreVersion operations.
[In VersionsSoap Server Details] These operations[DeleteAllVersions, DeleteVersion, GetVersions and RestoreVersion] are described in section 3.1.4.
[In Abstract Data Model] This section describes a conceptual model of possible data organization that an implementation maintains to participate in this protocol.
[In Abstract Data Model] The described organization is provided to facilitate the explanation of how the protocol behaves.
[In Abstract Data Model] This specification does not mandate that implementations adhere to this model as long as their external behavior is consistent with that described in this specification.
[In Abstract Data Model] For more details, see [MS-WSSTS] section 2.1.2.7, [MS-WSSTS] section 2.1.2.11, and [MS-WSSTS] section 2.1.2.11.1.3.

[In Message Processing Events and Sequencing Rules] The following table summarizes the list of operations as defined by this specification [DeleteAllVersions, DeleteVersion, GetVersions, RestoreVersion].
[In Message Processing Events and Sequencing Rules] Operation "DeleteAllVersions" deletes all the previous versions of the specified file.
[In Message Processing Events and Sequencing Rules] Operation "DeleteVersion" deletes the specified version of the file.
[In Message Processing Events and Sequencing Rules] Operation "GetVersions" gets details about all the versions of the specified file.
[In Message Processing Events and Sequencing Rules] Operation "RestoreVersion" restores the specified file to a specific version.
[In DeleteAllVersions operation] The DeleteAllVersions operation deletes all the previous versions of the specified file, except for the published version and the current version.
[In DeleteAllVersions operation] If the Recycle Bin is enabled, the versions are placed in the Recycle Bin, instead.

[In DeleteAllVersions operation][The schema of DeleteAllVersions is defined as:] <wsdl:operation name="DeleteAllVersions"> <wsdl:input message="tns:DeleteAllVersionsSoapIn" /> <wsdl:output message="tns:DeleteAllVersionsSoapOut" /> </wsdl:operation>
[In DeleteAllVersions operation] The protocol client sends a DeleteAllVersionsSoapIn request message.
[In DeleteAllVersions operation] [The protocol client sends a DeleteAllVersionsSoapIn request message], and the protocol server responds with a DeleteAllVersionsSoapOut response message.
[In Messages] The following table summarizes the set of WSDL message definitions that are specific to this operation.
[In Messages] DeleteAllVersionsSoapIn is the WSDL request message for a WSDL DeleteAllVersions operation.
[In Messages] [The description of message] DeleteAllVersionsSoapOut is the WSDL response message for a WSDL DeleteAllVersions operation.
[In DeleteAllVersionsSoapIn] The DeleteAllVersionsSoapIn message is the request message for deleting all previous versions of the specified file on the protocol server.
[DeleteAllVersionsSoapIn] The SOAP action value of the message [DeleteAllVersionsSoapIn] is: http://schemas.microsoft.com/sharepoint/soap/DeleteAllVersions.
[In DeleteAllVersionsSoapIn] The SOAP body contains a DeleteAllVersions element.
[In DeleteAllVersionsSoapOut] The DeleteAllVersionsSoapOut message is the response message for deleting all previous versions of the specified file on the protocol server.
[In DeleteAllVersionsSoapOut] The SOAP body contains a DeleteAllVersionsResponse element.
[In Elements] The following table summarizes the XML schema element definitions [DeleteAllVersions, DeleteAllVersionsResponse] that are specific to this operation [DeleteAllVersions].
[In Elements] DeleteAllVersions specify the input data for the DeleteAllVersions WSDL operation.
[In Elements] DeleteAllVersionsResponse specifies the result data for the DeleteAllVersions WSDL operation.
[In DeleteAllVersions] The DeleteAllVersions element specifies the input data for the DeleteAllVersions WSDL operation.

[In DeleteAllVersions] <s:element name="DeleteAllVersions"> <s:complexType> <s:sequence> <s:element name="fileName" type="s:string" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> </s:sequence> </s:complexType> </s:element>
[In DeleteAllVersions] fileName: An element as specified in section 2.2.3.1.
[In DeleteAllVersionsResponse] The DeleteAllVersionsResponse element specifies the result data for the DeleteAllVersions WSDL operation.

[In DeleteAllVersionsResponse][The schema of DeleteAllVersionsResponse element is defined as:] <s:element name="DeleteAllVersionsResponse"> <s:complexType> <s:sequence> <s:element minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1" name="DeleteAllVersionsResult"> <s:complexType> <s:sequence> <s:element name="results" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1" type="tns:Results" /> </s:sequence> </s:complexType> </s:element> </s:sequence> </s:complexType> </s:element>

[In DeleteAllVersionsResponse] DeleteAllVersionsResult: An XML node that conforms to the structure specified in section 2.2.4.1 and that contains the details about all the versions of the specified file that the user can access.

[In DeleteAllVersionsResponse] The error conditions that can be encountered during this operation generate the error codes that are shown in the following table [no error code element returned, 0x81020030].
[In DeleteAllVersionsResponse] No error code element returned indicate that the system cannot find the specified file. Exception from HRESULT: 0x80070002.<2>
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirements: MS-VERSS_R9301, MS-VERSS_R9302, MS-VERSS_R9303

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In DeleteAllVersionsResponse] Error code 0x81020030 SHOULD<3> indicate that the fileName element of the DeleteAllVersions element contains invalid characters<4>.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirements: MS-VERSS_R17201, MS-VERSS_R1930101, MS-VERSS_R1931101, MS-VERSS_R1930201, MS-VERSS_R1930202, MS-VERSS_R1930203, MS-VERSS_R1930204, MS-VERSS_R1930213, MS-VERSS_R1930214, MS-VERSS_R19302, MS-VERSS_R1930205,MS-VERSS_R1930208

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In DeleteAllVersionsResponse]Invalid characters are defined as the following: Double quotation mark ("), Pound sign (#), Percent sign (%), Ampersand (&), Asterisk (*), Colon (:), Left angle bracket (<), Equal sign (=), Right angle bracket (>), Question mark (?), Backward slash (\), Left curly bracket ({), Vertical bar (|), Right curly bracket (}), Tilde (~), Tab(\t), Two consecutive dots (..), Any character that has a value less than 32 or greater than 126.
[In DeleteVersion] The DeleteVersion operation deletes a specific version of the specified file.
[In DeleteVersion operation] If the Recycle Bin is enabled, the version is placed in the Recycle Bin, instead.
[In DeleteVersion] This operation [DeleteVersion operation] MUST NOT grant deletion of the current version of the file.
[In DeleteVersion] This operation [DeleteVersion operation] MUST NOT grant deletion of the published version of the file.

[In DeleteVersion][The schema of DeleteVersion is defined as:] <wsdl:operation name="DeleteVersion"> <wsdl:input message="tns:DeleteVersionSoapIn" /> <wsdl:output message="tns:DeleteVersionSoapOut" /> </wsdl:operation>
[In DeleteVersion] The protocol client sends a DeleteVersionSoapIn request message.
[In DeleteVersion] [The protocol client sends a DeleteVersionSoapIn request message,] and the protocol server responds with a DeleteVersionSoapOut response message.

[In DeleteVersionSoapIn] The DeleteVersionSoapIn message is the request message for deleting a specific version of the specified file on the protocol server.
[In DeleteVersionSoapIn] The SOAP action value of the message [DeleteVersionSoapIn] is: http://schemas.microsoft.com/sharepoint/soap/DeleteVersion.
[In DeleteVersionSoapIn] The SOAP body contains a DeleteVersion element.
[In DeleteVersionSoapOut] The DeleteVersionSoapOut message is the response message for deleting a version of the specified file on the protocol server.
[In DeleteVersionSoapOut] The SOAP body contains a DeleteVersionResponse element.

[In DeleteVersion] <s:element name="DeleteVersion"> <s:complexType> <s:sequence> <s:element name="fileName" type="s:string" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <s:element name="fileVersion" type="s:string" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> </s:sequence> </s:complexType> </s:element>
[In DeleteVersion] fileName: An element as specified in section 2.2.3.1.
[In DeleteVersion] fileVersion: An element as specified in section 2.2.3.2.
[In DeleteVersionResponse] The DeleteVersionResponse element specifies the result data for the DeleteVersion WSDL operation.

[In DeleteVersionResponse][The schema of DeleteVersionResponse element is defined as:] <s:element name="DeleteVersionResponse"> <s:complexType> <s:sequence> <s:element minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1" name="DeleteVersionResult"> <s:complexType> <s:sequence> <s:element name="results" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1" type="tns:Results" /> </s:sequence> </s:complexType> </s:element> </s:sequence> </s:complexType> </s:element>

[In DeleteVersionResponse] DeleteVersionResult: An XML node that conforms to the structure specified in section 2.2.4.1 and that contains the details about all the versions of the specified file that the user can access.

[In DeleteVersionResponse] Note that invalid characters are defined as the following: Double quotation mark ("), Pound sign (#), Percent sign (%), Ampersand (&), Asterisk (*), Colon (:), Left angle bracket (<), Equal sign (=), Right angle bracket (>), Question mark (?), Backward slash (\), Left curly bracket ({), Vertical bar (|), Right curly bracket (}), Tilde (~), Forward slash (/), Two consecutive dots (..), Any character that has a value less than 32 or greater than 126.
[In DeleteVersionResponse] Error code 0x81020073 SHOULD<5> indicate that the fileName element of the DeleteVersion element contains invalid characters.<6>
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirements: MS-VERSS_R17600, MS-VERSS_R17601, MS-VERSS_R17602, MS-VERSS_R17621, MS-VERSS_R19602, MS-VERSS_R1960102, MS-VERSS_R19620, MS-VERSS_R197, MS-VERSS_R19702, MS-VERSS_R19701, MS-VERSS_R19703, MS-VERSS_R19704, MS-VERSS_R19705

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In DeleteVersionResponse] If the specified version does not exist, error code 0x80131600 is returned.
[In DeleteVersionResponse] If the specified version was recently deleted, error code 0x80131600 is returned.
[In DeleteVersionResponse] Error code 0x80131600 is returned, when the value specified by the fileVersion element is the current version of the file <7>.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirements: MS-VERSS_R1780200, MS-VERSS_R198

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In DeleteVersionResponse] Error code 0x80131600 is returned, when the value specified by the fileVersion element is published version of the file<7>.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In GetVersions] The GetVersions operation gets details about all versions of the specified file that the user can access.

[In GetVersions] The protocol client sends a GetVersionsSoapIn request message.
[In GetVersions] [The protocol client sends a GetVersionsSoapIn request message,] and the protocol server responds with a GetVersionsSoapOut response message.

[In GetVersionsSoapIn] The SOAP action value of the message [GetVersionsSoapIn] is: http://schemas.microsoft.com/sharepoint/soap/GetVersions.
[In GetVersionsSoapIn] The SOAP body contains a GetVersions element.

[In GetVersions] fileName: An element as specified in section 2.2.3.1.

[In GetVersionsResponse] The error conditions that can be encountered during this operation generate the error code that is shown in the following table [No error code element returned].
[In GetVersionsResponse] If the system cannot find the specified file, no error code will be return.
[In GetVersionsResponse] when the system cannot find the specified file, exception from HRESULT: 0x80070002 will trigger.
[In RestoreVersion] The RestoreVersion operation restores the specified file to a specific version.
[In RestoreVersion] After the restoration, the current version number of the file MUST still be increased, as with any other change.

[In RestoreVersion][The schema of GetVersions is defined as:] <wsdl:operation name="RestoreVersion"> <wsdl:input message="tns:RestoreVersionSoapIn" /> <wsdl:output message="tns:RestoreVersionSoapOut" /> </wsdl:operation>
[In RestoreVersion] When restoring a version, the version MUST NOT be in the Recycle Bin.
[In RestoreVersion] When restoring a version, the version MUST NOT have been deleted.

[In RestoreVersion] If the file is not already at the checked out publishing level, and the protocol server enforces that only checked out files can be modified, this operation MUST NOT allow the restoration of the file.

[In RestoreVersion] If the protocol server enforces that only checked out files can be modified, the protocol client calls the CheckOutFile operation, as specified in [MS-LISTSWS] section 3.1.4.8, before calling this operation [RestoreVersion].

[In RestoreVersion] After calling this operation [RestoreVersion], the protocol client calls either the CheckInFile operation, as specified in [MS-LISTSWS] section 3.1.4.7, to commit the changes performed by this operation, or the UndoCheckOut operation, as specified in [MS-LISTSWS] section 3.1.4.26, to revert the changes performed by this operation [RestoreVersion].
[In RestoreVersion] If check out is not being enforced, it is not necessary to check out the file before the restoration, and it is not necessary to check in the file after the restoration.
[In RestoreVersion] If the file is not checked out before the restoration, the current version number of the file MUST still be increased, as with any other change.
[In RestoreVersion] If the file is checked out, the current version number of the file after restoration MUST remain the same as before restoration.
[In RestoreVersion] The protocol client sends a RestoreVersionSoapIn request message.
[In RestoreVersion] [The protocol client sends a RestoreVersionSoapIn request message,] and the protocol server responds with a RestoreVersionSoapOut response message.
[In Messages] The following table summarizes the set of WSDL message definitions that are specific to this operation[RestoreVersion].
[In Messages] [The description of message] RestoreVersionSoapIn is the WSDL request message for a WSDL RestoreVersion operation.
[In Messages] [The description of message] RestoreVersionSoapOut is the WSDL response message for a WSDL RestoreVersion operation.
[In RestoreVersionSoapIn] The RestoreVersionSoapIn message is the request message for restoring the specified file to a specific version.
[In RestoreVersionSoapIn] The SOAP action value of the message [RestoreVersionSoapIn] is: http://schemas.microsoft.com/sharepoint/soap/RestoreVersion.
[In RestoreVersionSoapIn] The SOAP body contains a RestoreVersion element.
[In RestoreVersionSoapOut] The RestoreVersionSoapOut message is the response message for restoring the specified file to a specific version.
[In RestoreVersionSoapOut] The SOAP body contains a RestoreVersionResponse element.
[In Elements] The following table summarizes the XML schema element definitions that are specific to this operation.
[In Elements] RestoreVersion specifies the input data for the RestoreVersion WSDL operation.
[In Elements] RestoreVersionResponse specifies the result data for the RestoreVersion WSDL operation.
[In RestoreVersion] The RestoreVersion element specifies the input data for the RestoreVersion WSDL operation.

[In RestoreVersion] <s:element name="RestoreVersion"> <s:complexType> <s:sequence> <s:element name="fileName" type="s:string" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <s:element name="fileVersion" type="s:string" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> </s:sequence> </s:complexType> </s:element>
[In RestoreVersion] fileName: An element as specified in section 2.2.3.1.
[In RestoreVersion] fileVersion: An element as specified in section 2.2.3.2.
[In RestoreVersionResponse] The RestoreVersionResponse element specifies the result data for the RestoreVersion WSDL operation.

[In RestoreVersionResponse][The schema of RestoreVersionResponse element is defined as:] <s:element name="RestoreVersionResponse"> <s:complexType> <s:sequence> <s:element minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1" name="RestoreVersionResult"> <s:complexType> <s:sequence> <s:element name="results" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1" type="tns:Results" /> </s:sequence> </s:complexType> </s:element> </s:sequence> </s:complexType> </s:element>

[In RestoreVersionResponse] RestoreVersionResult: MUST return an XML node that conforms to the structure specified in section 2.2.4.1, which contains the details about all the versions of the specified file that the user can access.

[In RestoreVersionResponse] The error conditions that can be encountered during this operation generate the error codes that are shown in the following table [No error code element returned, 0x8007009E, 0x81020073].
[In RestoreVersionResponse] No error code element returned indicate that the file specified by the fileName and fileVersion elements of the RestoreVersion element could not be found on the site.<8>
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirements: MS-VERSS_R15301, MS-VERSS_R204

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RestoreVersionResponse] Note that invalid characters are defined as the following:Percent sign (%), Ampersand (&), Asterisk (*), Colon (:), Left angle bracket (<), Right angle bracket (>), Question mark (?), Forward slash (/), Left curly bracket ({), Vertical bar (|), Right curly bracket (}), Tilde (~), Double quotation mark ("), Backward slash (\), Two consecutive dots (..), Any character that has a value less than 32 or greater than 126.
[In RestoreVersionResponse] Error code 0x8007009E is returned if the file is not checked out. <9>
